metadata.title: CVE-2016-6298 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The _Rsa15 class in the RSA 1.5 algorithm implementation in jwa.py injwcrypto before 0.3.2 lacks the Random Filling protection mechanism, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to obtain cleartext data via a MillionMessage Attack (MMA).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-jwcrypto - 0.4.2-1
python3-jwcrypto - 0.4.2-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-jwcrypto package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.2-1').
